manifest.name: action.github.EMOJIS_GET
manifest.longDescription: Lists all the emojis available to use on GitHub.

manifest.name: action.github.FEEDS_GET
manifest.longDescription: List Feeds. GitHub provides several timeline resources in Atom format. The Feeds API  lists all the feeds available to the authenticating user.

manifest.name: action.github.GISTS_GET
manifest.longDescription: List the authenticated user's gists or if called anonymously, this will return all public gists.

manifest.name: action.github.GISTS_ID_COMMENTS_COMMENT_ID_DELETE
manifest.displayName: delete gists id comments comment id
manifest.shortDescription: delete gists id comments comment id

manifest.name: action.github.GISTS_ID_COMMENTS_COMMENT_ID_GET
manifest.displayName: get gists id comments comment id
manifest.shortDescription: get gists id comments comment id

manifest.name: action.github.GISTS_ID_COMMENTS_COMMENT_ID_PATCH
manifest.displayName: patch gists id comments comment id
manifest.shortDescription: patch gists id comments comment id

manifest.name: action.github.GISTS_ID_STAR_GET
manifest.longDescription: Check if a gist is starred.

manifest.name: action.github.GISTS_STARRED_GET
manifest.longDescription: List the authenticated user's starred gists.

manifest.name: action.github.GITIGNORE_TEMPLATES_GET
manifest.longDescription: Listing available templates. List all templates available to pass as an option when creating a repository.

manifest.name: action.github.ISSUES_GET
manifest.longDescription: List issues. List all issues across all the authenticated user's visible repositories.

manifest.name: action.github.LEGACY_ISSUES_SEARCH_OWNER_REPOSITORY_STATE_KEYWORD_GET
manifest.displayName: get legacy issues search owner repository state keyword
manifest.shortDescription: get legacy issues search owner repository state keyword
manifest.longDescription: Find issues by state and keyword.

manifest.name: action.github.LEGACY_REPOS_SEARCH_KEYWORD_GET
manifest.longDescription: Find repositories by keyword. Note, this legacy method does not follow the v3 pagination pattern. This method returns up to 100 results per page and pages can be fetched using the start_page parameter.

manifest.name: action.github.LEGACY_USER_EMAIL_EMAIL_GET
manifest.longDescription: This API call is added for compatibility reasons only.

manifest.name: action.github.MARKDOWN_RAW_POST
manifest.longDescription: Render a Markdown document in raw mode

manifest.name: action.github.META_GET
manifest.longDescription: This gives some information about GitHub.com, the service.

manifest.name: action.github.NETWORKS_OWNER_REPO_EVENTS_GET
manifest.longDescription: List public events for a network of repositories.

manifest.name: action.github.NOTIFICATIONS_GET
manifest.longDescription: List your notifications. List all notifications for the current user, grouped by repository.

manifest.name: action.github.NOTIFICATIONS_PUT
manifest.longDescription: Mark as read. Marking a notification as \"read\" removes it from the default view on GitHub.com.

manifest.name: action.github.NOTIFICATIONS_THREADS_ID_SUBSCRIPTION_PUT
manifest.longDescription: Set a Thread Subscription. This lets you subscribe to a thread, or ignore it. Subscribing to a thread is unnecessary if the user is already subscribed to the repository. Ignoring a thread will mute all future notifications (until you comment or get @mentioned).

manifest.name: action.github.ORGS_ORG_EVENTS_GET
manifest.longDescription: List public events for an organization.

manifest.name: action.github.ORGS_ORG_ISSUES_GET
manifest.longDescription: List issues. List all issues for a given organization for the authenticated user.

manifest.name: action.github.ORGS_ORG_MEMBERS_GET
manifest.longDescription: Members list. List all users who are members of an organization. A member is a user tha belongs to at least 1 team in the organization. If the authenticated user is also an owner of this organization then both concealed and public members will be returned. If the requester is not an owner of the organization the query will be redirected to the public members list.

manifest.name: action.github.ORGS_ORG_MEMBERS_USERNAME_DELETE
manifest.longDescription: Remove a member. Removing a user from this list will remove them from all teams and they will no longer have any access to the organization's repositories.

manifest.name: action.github.ORGS_ORG_MEMBERS_USERNAME_GET
manifest.longDescription: Check if a user is, publicly or privately, a member of the organization.

manifest.name: action.github.ORGS_ORG_PUBLIC_MEMBERS_GET
manifest.longDescription: Public members list. Members of an organization can choose to have their membership publicized or not.

manifest.name: action.github.ORGS_ORG_PUBLIC_MEMBERS_USERNAME_DELETE
manifest.displayName: delete orgs org public members username
manifest.shortDescription: delete orgs org public members username

manifest.name: action.github.ORGS_ORG_PUBLIC_MEMBERS_USERNAME_GET
manifest.displayName: get orgs org public members username
manifest.shortDescription: get orgs org public members username

manifest.name: action.github.ORGS_ORG_PUBLIC_MEMBERS_USERNAME_PUT
manifest.displayName: put orgs org public members username
manifest.shortDescription: put orgs org public members username

manifest.name: action.github.ORGS_ORG_REPOS_GET
manifest.longDescription: List repositories for the specified org.

manifest.name: action.github.ORGS_ORG_REPOS_POST
manifest.longDescription: Create a new repository for the authenticated user. OAuth users must supply repo scope.

manifest.name: action.github.ORGS_ORG_TEAMS_POST
manifest.longDescription: Create team. In order to create a team, the authenticated user must be an owner of organization.

manifest.name: action.github.RATE_LIMIT_GET
manifest.longDescription: Get your current rate limit status Note: Accessing this endpoint does not count against your rate limit.

manifest.name: action.github.REPOS_OWNER_REPO_ARCHIVE_FORMAT_PATH_GET
manifest.displayName: get repos owner repo archive format path
manifest.shortDescription: get repos owner repo archive format path
manifest.longDescription: Get archive link. This method will return a 302 to a URL to download a tarball or zipball archive for a repository. Please make sure your HTTP framework is configured to follow redirects or you will need to use the Location header to make a second GET request. Note: For private repositories, these links are temporary and expire quickly.

manifest.name: action.github.REPOS_OWNER_REPO_ASSIGNEES_ASSIGNEE_GET
manifest.displayName: get repos owner repo assignees assignee
manifest.shortDescription: get repos owner repo assignees assignee
manifest.longDescription: Check assignee. You may also check to see if a particular user is an assignee for a repository.

manifest.name: action.github.REPOS_OWNER_REPO_ASSIGNEES_GET
manifest.longDescription: List assignees. This call lists all the available assignees (owner + collaborators) to which issues may be assigned.

manifest.name: action.github.REPOS_OWNER_REPO_BRANCHES_BRANCH_GET
manifest.displayName: get repos owner repo branches branch
manifest.shortDescription: get repos owner repo branches branch

manifest.name: action.github.REPOS_OWNER_REPO_COLLABORATORS_GET
manifest.longDescription: List. When authenticating as an organization owner of an organization-owned repository, all organization owners are included in the list of collaborators. Otherwise, only users with access to the repository are returned in the collaborators list.

To access this endpoint during the preview period, you must provide a custom media type in the Accept header: application/vnd.github.she-hulk-preview+json

manifest.name: action.github.REPOS_OWNER_REPO_CONTENTS_PATH_GET
manifest.displayName: get repos owner repo contents path
manifest.shortDescription: get repos owner repo contents path
manifest.longDescription: Get contents. This method returns the contents of a file or directory in a repository. Files and symlinks support a custom media type for getting the raw content. Directories and submodules do not support custom media types. Note: This API supports files up to 1 megabyte in size. Here can be many outcomes. For details see \"http://developer.github.com/v3/repos/contents/\"

manifest.shortDescription: get repos owner repo git blobs sha code
manifest.longDescription: Get a Blob. Since blobs can be any arbitrary binary data, the input and responses for the blob API takes an encoding parameter that can be either utf-8 or base64. If your data cannot be losslessly sent as a UTF-8 string, you can base64 encode it.

manifest.longDescription: Delete a Reference Example: Deleting a branch: DELETE /repos/octocat/Hello-World/git/refs/heads/feature-a  Example: Deleting a tag:        DELETE /repos/octocat/Hello-World/git/refs/tags/v1.0

manifest.name: action.github.REPOS_OWNER_REPO_GIT_TAGS_POST
manifest.displayName: post repos owner repo git tags
manifest.shortDescription: post repos owner repo git tags
manifest.longDescription: Create a Tag Object. Note that creating a tag object does not create the reference that makes a tag in Git. If you want to create an annotated tag in Git, you have to do this call to create the tag object, and then create the refs/tags/[tag] reference. If you want to create a lightweight tag, you only have to create the tag reference - this call would be unnecessary.

manifest.name: action.github.REPOS_OWNER_REPO_GIT_TAGS_SHA_CODE_GET

manifest.shortDescription: get repos owner repo git tags sha code

manifest.displayName: post repos owner repo git trees
manifest.shortDescription: post repos owner repo git trees
manifest.longDescription: Create a Tree. The tree creation API will take nested entries as well. If both a tree and a nested path modifying that tree are specified, it will overwrite the contents of that tree with the new path contents and write a new tree out.

manifest.name: action.github.REPOS_OWNER_REPO_STATS_CODE_FREQUENCY_GET
manifest.displayName: get repos owner repo stats code frequency
manifest.shortDescription: get repos owner repo stats code frequency
manifest.longDescription: Get the number of additions and deletions per week. Returns a weekly aggregate of the number of additions and deletions pushed to a repository.

manifest.name: action.github.REPOS_OWNER_REPO_STATS_COMMIT_ACTIVITY_GET
manifest.displayName: get repos owner repo stats commit activity
manifest.shortDescription: get repos owner repo stats commit activity
manifest.longDescription: Get the last year of commit activity data. Returns the last year of commit activity grouped by week. The days array is a group of commits per day, starting on Sunday.

manifest.name: action.github.REPOS_OWNER_REPO_STATS_CONTRIBUTORS_GET
manifest.displayName: get repos owner repo stats contributors
manifest.shortDescription: get repos owner repo stats contributors
manifest.longDescription: Get contributors list with additions, deletions, and commit counts.

manifest.name: action.github.REPOS_OWNER_REPO_STATS_PARTICIPATION_GET
manifest.displayName: get repos owner repo stats participation
manifest.shortDescription: get repos owner repo stats participation
manifest.longDescription: Get the weekly commit count for the repo owner and everyone else.

manifest.name: action.github.REPOS_OWNER_REPO_STATS_PUNCH_CARD_GET
manifest.displayName: get repos owner repo stats punch card
manifest.shortDescription: get repos owner repo stats punch card
manifest.longDescription: Get the number of commits per hour in each day. Each array contains the day number, hour number, and number of commits 0-6 Sunday - Saturday 0-23 Hour of day Number of commits  For example, [2, 14, 25] indicates that there were 25 total commits, during the 2.00pm hour on Tuesdays. All times are based on the time zone of individual commits.

manifest.name: action.github.REPOS_OWNER_REPO_STATUSES_REF_GET
manifest.displayName: get repos owner repo statuses ref
manifest.shortDescription: get repos owner repo statuses ref
manifest.longDescription: List Statuses for a specific Ref.

manifest.name: action.github.REPOS_OWNER_REPO_STATUSES_REF_POST
manifest.displayName: post repos owner repo statuses ref
manifest.shortDescription: post repos owner repo statuses ref

manifest.name: action.github.REPOSITORIES_GET
manifest.longDescription: List all public repositories. This provides a dump of every public repository, in the order that they were created. Note: Pagination is powered exclusively by the since parameter. is the Link header to get the URL for the next page of repositories.

manifest.name: action.github.SEARCH_ISSUES_GET
manifest.longDescription: Find issues by state and keyword. (This method returns up to 100 results per page.)

manifest.name: action.github.TEAMS_TEAM_ID_DELETE
manifest.longDescription: Delete team. In order to delete a team, the authenticated user must be an owner of the org that the team is associated with.

manifest.name: action.github.TEAMS_TEAM_ID_MEMBERS_GET
manifest.longDescription: List team members. In order to list members in a team, the authenticated user must be a member of the team.

manifest.name: action.github.TEAMS_TEAM_ID_MEMBERS_USERNAME_DELETE
manifest.displayName: delete teams team id members username
manifest.shortDescription: delete teams team id members username
manifest.longDescription: The \"Remove team member\" API is deprecated and is scheduled for removal in the next major version of the API. We recommend using the Remove team membership API instead. It allows you to remove both active and pending memberships.  Remove team member. In order to remove a user from a team, the authenticated user must have 'admin' permissions to the team or be an owner of the org that the team is associated with. NOTE This does not delete the user, it just remove them from the team.

manifest.name: action.github.TEAMS_TEAM_ID_MEMBERS_USERNAME_GET
manifest.displayName: get teams team id members username
manifest.shortDescription: get teams team id members username
manifest.longDescription: The \"Get team member\" API is deprecated and is scheduled for removal in the next major version of the API. We recommend using the Get team membership API instead. It allows you to get both active and pending memberships.  Get team member. In order to get if a user is a member of a team, the authenticated user mus be a member of the team.

manifest.name: action.github.TEAMS_TEAM_ID_MEMBERS_USERNAME_PUT
manifest.displayName: put teams team id members username
manifest.shortDescription: put teams team id members username
manifest.longDescription: The API (described below) is deprecated and is scheduled for removal in the next major version of the API. We recommend using the Add team membership API instead. It allows you to invite new organization members to your teams.  Add team member. In order to add a user to a team, the authenticated user must have 'admin' permissions to the team or be an owner of the org that the team is associated with.

manifest.name: action.github.TEAMS_TEAM_ID_MEMBERSHIPS_USERNAME_DELETE
manifest.displayName: delete teams team id memberships username
manifest.shortDescription: delete teams team id memberships username
manifest.longDescription: Remove team membership. In order to remove a membership between a user and a team, the authenticated user must have 'admin' permissions to the team or be an owner of the organization that the team is associated with. NOTE: This does not delete the user, it just removes their membership from the team.

manifest.name: action.github.TEAMS_TEAM_ID_MEMBERSHIPS_USERNAME_GET
manifest.displayName: get teams team id memberships username
manifest.shortDescription: get teams team id memberships username
manifest.longDescription: Get team membership. In order to get a user's membership with a team, the authenticated user must be a member of the team or an owner of the team's organization.

manifest.name: action.github.TEAMS_TEAM_ID_MEMBERSHIPS_USERNAME_PUT
manifest.displayName: put teams team id memberships username
manifest.shortDescription: put teams team id memberships username
manifest.longDescription: Add team membership. In order to add a membership between a user and a team, the authenticated user must have 'admin' permissions to the team or be an owner of the organization that the team is associated with.  If the user is already a part of the team's organization (meaning they're on at least one other team in the organization), this endpoint will add the user to the team.  If the user is completely unaffiliated with the team's organization (meaning they're on none of the organization's teams), this endpoint will send an invitation to the user via email. This newly-created membership will be in the 'pending' state until the user accepts the invitation, at which point the membership will transition to the 'active' state and the user will be added as a member of the team.

manifest.name: action.github.TEAMS_TEAM_ID_PATCH
manifest.longDescription: Edit team. In order to edit a team, the authenticated user must be an owner of the org that the team is associated with.

manifest.name: action.github.TEAMS_TEAM_ID_REPOS_OWNER_REPO_DELETE
manifest.displayName: delete teams team id repos owner repo
manifest.shortDescription: delete teams team id repos owner repo
manifest.longDescription: In order to remove a repository from a team, the authenticated user must be an owner of the org that the team is associated with. NOTE: This does not delete the repository, it just removes it from the team.

manifest.name: action.github.TEAMS_TEAM_ID_REPOS_OWNER_REPO_GET
manifest.displayName: get teams team id repos owner repo
manifest.shortDescription: get teams team id repos owner repo
manifest.longDescription: Check if a team manages a repository

manifest.name: action.github.TEAMS_TEAM_ID_REPOS_OWNER_REPO_PUT
manifest.displayName: put teams team id repos owner repo
manifest.shortDescription: put teams team id repos owner repo
manifest.longDescription: In order to add a repository to a team, the authenticated user must be an owner of the org that the team is associated with. Also, the repository must be owned by the organization, or a direct fork of a repository owned by the organization.

manifest.name: action.github.USER_EMAILS_DELETE
manifest.longDescription: Delete email address(es). You can include a single email address or an array of addresses.

manifest.name: action.github.USER_EMAILS_GET
manifest.longDescription: List email addresses for a user. In the final version of the API, this method will return an array of hashes with extended information for each email address indicating if the address has been verified and if it's primary email address for GitHub. Until API v3 is finalized, use the application/vnd.github.v3 media type to get other response format.

manifest.name: action.github.USER_EMAILS_POST
manifest.longDescription: Add email address(es). You can post a single email address or an array of addresses.

manifest.name: action.github.USER_FOLLOWING_GET
manifest.longDescription: List who the authenticated user is following.

manifest.name: action.github.USER_FOLLOWING_USERNAME_DELETE
manifest.longDescription: Unfollow a user. Unfollowing a user requires the user to be logged in and authenticated with basic auth or OAuth with the user:follow scope.

manifest.name: action.github.USER_FOLLOWING_USERNAME_GET
manifest.longDescription: Check if you are following a user.

manifest.name: action.github.USER_FOLLOWING_USERNAME_PUT
manifest.longDescription: Follow a user. Following a user requires the user to be logged in and authenticated with basic auth or OAuth with the user:follow scope.

manifest.name: action.github.USER_ISSUES_GET
manifest.longDescription: List issues. List all issues across owned and member repositories for the authenticated user.

manifest.name: action.github.USER_KEYS_GET
manifest.longDescription: List your public keys. Lists the current user's keys. Management of public keys via the API requires that you are authenticated through basic auth, or OAuth with the 'user', 'write:public_key' scopes.

manifest.name: action.github.USER_KEYS_KEY_ID_DELETE
manifest.longDescription: Delete a public key. Removes a public key. Requires that you are authenticated via Basic Auth or via OAuth with at least admin:public_key scope.

manifest.name: action.github.USER_ORGS_GET
manifest.longDescription: List public and private organizations for the authenticated user.

manifest.name: action.github.USER_REPOS_GET
manifest.longDescription: List repositories for the authenticated user. Note that this does not include repositories owned by organizations which the user can access. You can lis user organizations and list organization repositories separately.

manifest.name: action.github.USER_REPOS_POST
manifest.longDescription: Create a new repository for the authenticated user. OAuth users must supply repo scope.

manifest.name: action.github.USER_STARRED_GET
manifest.longDescription: List repositories being starred by the authenticated user.

manifest.name: action.github.USER_STARRED_OWNER_REPO_GET
manifest.longDescription: Check if you are starring a repository.

manifest.name: action.github.USER_SUBSCRIPTIONS_GET
manifest.longDescription: List repositories being watched by the authenticated user.

manifest.name: action.github.USER_SUBSCRIPTIONS_OWNER_REPO_GET
manifest.longDescription: Check if you are watching a repository.

manifest.name: action.github.USER_TEAMS_GET
manifest.longDescription: List all of the teams across all of the organizations to which the authenticated user belongs. This method requires user or repo scope when authenticating via OAuth.

manifest.name: action.github.USERS_GET
manifest.longDescription: Get all users. This provides a dump of every user, in the order that they signed up for GitHub. Note: Pagination is powered exclusively by the since parameter. Use the Link header to get the URL for the next page of users.

manifest.name: action.github.USERS_USERNAME_EVENTS_GET
manifest.longDescription: If you are authenticated as the given user, you will see your private events. Otherwise, you'll only see public events.

manifest.name: action.github.USERS_USERNAME_EVENTS_ORGS_ORG_GET
manifest.displayName: get users username events orgs org
manifest.shortDescription: get users username events orgs org
manifest.longDescription: This is the user's organization dashboard. You must be authenticated as the user to view this.

manifest.name: action.github.USERS_USERNAME_FOLLOWING_TARGET_USER_GET
manifest.displayName: get users username following tar user get
manifest.shortDescription: get users username following tar user get
manifest.longDescription: Check if one user follows another.

manifest.name: action.github.USERS_USERNAME_KEYS_GET
manifest.longDescription: List public keys for a user. Lists the verified public keys for a user. This is accessible by anyone.

manifest.name: action.github.USERS_USERNAME_ORGS_GET
manifest.longDescription: List all public organizations for a user.

manifest.name: action.github.USERS_USERNAME_RECEIVED_EVENTS_GET
manifest.longDescription: These are events that you'll only see public events.

manifest.name: action.github.USERS_USERNAME_RECEIVED_EVENTS_PUBLIC_GET
manifest.displayName: get users username received events public
manifest.shortDescription: get users username received events public
manifest.longDescription: List public events that a user has received

manifest.name: action.github.USERS_USERNAME_REPOS_GET
manifest.longDescription: List public repositories for the specified user.

manifest.name: action.github.USERS_USERNAME_STARRED_GET
manifest.longDescription: List repositories being starred by a user.

manifest.name: action.github.USERS_USERNAME_SUBSCRIPTIONS_GET
manifest.longDescription: List repositories being watched by a user.
